com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess

Interface ResourceHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ResourceCopier

    public interface ResourceHandler
    A PreProcessor invokes the same ResourceHandler to process all the resources (that is, image, audio, video) contained in all the documents being preprocessed. However, a ResourceHandler is invoked only for resources having an URL which is relative to the document being preprocessed, not for resource having an absolute URL.

    A basic ResourceHandler copies its resource argument to a directory which is part of the deliverable. A more sophisticated ResourceHandler may convert its resource argument to a different format (example: convert a .svg image to .png).

        Media getMedia()
        Returns the media, print or screen, associated to the output format. Initial value: Media.SCREEN.
        See Also:
        setMedia(com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.Media)

      • parseParameters

        void parseParameters(java.lang.String parameters)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses specified parameter string.
        Parameters:
        parameters - parameter string having a syntax which is specific to this ResourceHandler
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If for any reason this operation fails

      • reset

        void reset()
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Reset the internal state of this ResourceHandler. Invoked by the PreProcessor before a run. Allows the PreProcessor to reuse the same ResourceHandler to process several documents.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • handleResource

        java.lang.String handleResource(java.net.URL resourceURL,
                                java.lang.String resourceType,
                                boolean isImage,
                                java.io.File outDir,
                                Console console)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Process specified resource.
        Parameters:
        resourceURL - The URL of the resource to be processed
        resourceType - The MIME type of the resource; null if unknown
        isImage - true if the resource is for sure an image file
        outDir - The directory where the input resource, as is or modified, is to be copied
        console - Console on which progress, trace, debug, etc, message can be displayed. May be null.
        Returns:
        The properly escaped, relative to outDir, URL of the processed resource.

        Return null if default processing is to take place. The default processing does nothing at all and returns resourceURL.toExternalForm(). This means that the deliverable will point to the resources referenced in the source document.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if, for any reason, this operation fails
